reviewText: Completely disppointing.

Poorly translated English subtitles, including misspellings and unintelligible sentences. Poor sound, dull visuals, and blurry background graphics. Some professors make an effort to be expressive in front of the camera; others are unsuited to the task and read quickly  without any variation in tone or emphasis. I got through only two-thirds of the course. As to content, it's hard to say what specific information was being presented, as mostly it was variations on the theme that cultural and mercantile trade occurred among various Mediterranean cities in the 16th and 17th centuries. And spices (not species). The information is very general, and assumes you know the major players and an overall timeline of the period. North Africa is largely ignored. This seems to be a labor of love by a group of acolytes of a 20th-century French historian who are advancing his theses. All very well, but not communicated effectively.

Most of the lectures were  very rushed and brief.  They quote facts and names  and rarely  bother to elaborate on them. The "interviews" that often serve as a second lecture for the week mostly repeat the first lecture /average duration for both - 5 minutes/Almost no reading materials in english. The translations in English isn't very good.The peer review processes for the final assignment  is flawed, since you will be given to review works in spanish and english, with no option to"skip" to an essay in a language you understand. The grading criteria is also flawed. For example the required length of the essay does not seem to be obligatory.The staff rarely bothers with answers in the discussion forumAll in all it is an interesting topic, and a good starting point for  your own research. Sadly, It is one of the worst courses i have taken part in.

Un curso verdaderamente interesante  por temas y enfoques. Un gracias a los profesores de la Universidad por su
tiempo y conocimientos y todo material y texto de profundización.  En cuanto a los vídeos, creo que pusieron demasiada
información en muy poco tiempo, lo que hace que algunos vídeos fueran pesados y
difíciles de seguir, ya que eran sólo una cadena de nombres y fechas. Hubiera
preferido algo más conversacional.

This course is a really good introduction to Mediterranean Studies for people with an interest in history. It touches on the academic features without being too complicated for people unused to academic learning. For an experienced history student, the course is slightly less valuable as it is quite easy and simple in points, I still found a lot of interest in the course. The only other thing that let the course down was the English translation which could be quite inconsistent and patchy. Nonetheless, it was informative and enjoyable.

The course was very interesting and it gave some good ideas, however I felt that it tried to teach too much in too shot time. It would have been better if thee would have been less themes but each of them deepened more - or the same amount of themes but in this case more time dedicated to each of them (not just a 30 min class, but maybe 1-2hours). Now I feel like for each theme we scatched the surface but didn't eally went into them

Problems with translation from Spanish to English creating confusion to non - Spanish students. Not all the lectures are translated. I have noticed that some English translation is missing or is incorrect. Also, since I am a non - Spanish student  I can not review correctly and accordingly Spanish posted assignments due to language barriers.
Too fast speech/ language use in combination with poor english translation, otherwise pretty well done.
El presentador de los dos primeros videos lee continuamente el material, un material que debe dominar y que est

1. Sometimes the audio of the recordings is poor, making it difficult to listen. 2. For non-speakers of Spanish, the translations are not so great and sometimes lack proper grammar or are almost literal translations of the spoken Spanish version. This makes the subject matter, although very interesting, very difficult to fully grasp. This also occurs in the quizzes, causing me to either misunderstand or not understand the questions.  Overall, it is a very interesting course but the 'execution' is not up to standard. It could be improved by updating the audio recordings, and correcting the translations for the subtitles
The course material was good but the lectures being in Spanish with English translations was difficult to follow.  I was disappointed in the short videos with subtitles.

I​ thought the course was interesting, covering a wide range of topics. Giving 4 stars, because it's in Spanish with English subtitles--I was subtitled movies all the time!!, but always have trouble listening to Spanish but reading English, not sure why.   Not a fault of the course, but an fyi if you are like me in that aspect.G​lad I took it!

I enjoyed the material and the focus of the course.  Thank you for your hard work in producing this course. In the current world situation being able to study and learn is very helpful to keeping one's sanity.
Los subtítulos en inglés deberián ser opcionales.
Me encanta! Un curso ligero, interesante y que ayuda a complementar de forma única los conocimientos básicos de un profesionista
needs more written material accessible in English for the non-Spanish speaker to delve further into in order to understand the lectures in greater depth.
better translation to be made available please..and the source,if it can be translated, maybe..

I enjoyed this course. I wish you had gone more in-depth in regards to the Moors. If you ever decide to do a course fundamentally focused on Moorish Spain, please contact me. I'd love to take that class.Sincerely, AB
Fast paced!
Está bastante bien, y es interesante ver el Mediterráneo durante la Edad Moderna

Wide-ranging and inclusive coverage of a vastly complex topic by an impressive list of erudite instructors.  Very interesting, with very many jump-off points for further study.  However... many of the translations into English were difficult to decipher, some to the point of near-obscurity.  Sorry to say, translating of words does not reliably lead to transfer of meaning.   Still, highly recommended for its reach in surveying the high points of the subject matter.  Thank you!
This course is very interesting and educational. I really enjoyed it.  My only complaint is that sometimes there wasnt any translation from spanish.
Excelente!
Excelente curso, muy ilustrativo y muy completo... debería haber una siguiente parte

curso muy completo, conciso y con la información necesaria para entender aspectos importantes que impactaron la economía y el intercambio en este espacio importante para las interacciones entre las regiones. Me ha ayudado mucho. ¡Mil gracias!.
I finished all the exams required 8 days ago, and did my assingnment and reviewed 4 peers but still i did'nt get the certificate, i don't know why!!!
Un curso maravilloso, lleno de una entereza histórica increíble, que complementa de cabo a rabo, mi formación en filosofía. Agradecida por tan distinguidos ponentes y por tan excelentes entrevistas.
Curso muy interesante, bien llevado y tocando un abanico amplio de tema relacionados

Enjoyable course, perhaps a bit biased in its coverage towards Spain and basically ignoring the Ottoman Empire arguably the major power in the Mediterranean during the period in question.As previous posters have commented, it is difficult for non-Spanish speaker and vice-versa to review submissions not in their native language.
Excelente curso, muy buen curso para las personas que les gusta la historia.
muy bueno,me dan ganas de conocer mes acerca de esa parte del mundo

It covers a broad topic very well.  Although the lectures are in Spanish, the in-video captions are well translated into English.  Some translations are missing toward the end of the course, but toggling the video's subtitles and using online translation programs can help overcome these instances.  The final paper is very helpful for those wanting to practice their research skills.
Muy buen curso, en contenido, en metodología. Buenas las opiniones del grupo. Muchas felicitaciones y agradecimientos.

Un excelente curso,aprendí mucho sobre diversos temas del Mediterraneo,o recomiendo para todo aquel que quiera adentrarse en el mundo de la historía! Felicitaciones al equipo de trabajo de la Universidad de Barcelona !

Un curso bien armado, y con un enfoque interesante y que entusiasma a partir de la obra de Broudel. Felicitaciones.Algunas sugerencias con ánimo de mejorar aún más su excelencia:(i) Una breve descripción  de cada lugar de Barcelona donde se dicta cada clase; algo se dice pero un poquito más (qué se exhibe allí; época de construcción, uso antes y actual, etc.) sería interesante, y que la cámara hiciera un brevísimo recorrido;(ii) Respecto a las referencias a los cuadros y obras de arte que se van mostrando intercalados durante las exposiciones,  su identificación está al final de cada lección; esto dificulta su correlato con la obra mostrada; si se pudiera poner una leyenda al mostrarlas, y si eso parece que puede distraer, ver de hacer un corte a la lección y presentar tres ó cuatro todas juntas y con breve referencia  escrita.(iii) Quizá un mayor uso de mapas por parte de los expositores, que pueden ser interactivos (mostrar las rutas, lugares como por ejemplo Lepanto, la ubicación de los puertos con un poco más de detenimiento, la costa africana sobre el Mediterráneo en auqel entonces y ahora...).Por favor, son solo ideas y en modo alguno desmerece la calidad y muy buena organización del curso.Gracias.José Luis Rinaldi
Este ha sido un curso muy interesante en el que hemos aprendido muchísimo sobre Historia Moderna
Tanto los temas como los instructores fueron muy buenos, la información es súper digerible e invita a conocer más sobre este mundo unido por un hermoso cuerpo de agua.
Fue esta mi primera experiencia on line. Y con un tema en el cual me sentí atrapada desde el comienzo. Me gustaría hubiera más de este tipo, y en español . Los felicito.
Excelente
El curso me permitió tener una visión más amplia, concreta y profunda del Mediterráneo.
Very informative and helpful for my genealogical research, as well as for sparking much curiosity. I feel I'm picking up a little Spanish too!
Excelente curso. Felicitaciones a la Universidad de Barcelona.

Wonderful course! I loved every part, it gave me a huge comprehension about this history chapter that is enormously important for us. This course was a gift for me, and I am very glad with the professors, Coursera and the University for the opportunity.
excelente
An incredible experience. Congratulations
Maravilloso curso! 100% recomendable
This is the second course I have from Universitat de Barcelona. Both outstanding.

If you are in love with history, western civilizations, the Middle East and everything related to the Roman Mare Nostrum, you will not regret taking this MOOC. Those professors, lecturers and scholars in charge of the course will not let you down.
EXCELENTE MARAVILLOSO, ME ENCANTO.
Broad overview of subject with interesting essays from fellow students
Very interesting and interdisciplinary course. Congratulations for you great job.
Gran descripción historica acerca del Mediterraneo .
Very good course
A very interesting and accessible course with plenty of reading suggestions for those of us who want to continue learn
Excelentes profesores. Los temas muy completos y además muy interesantes.
Es fenomenal, abarca el Mediterráneo desde todos los puntos de vista y esto hace que uno tenga más y más ganas de aprender acerca de este gran mar.

Un curso que cubre varias áreas de intercambio de ideas en el Mediterraneo: religioso, político, familiar, gastronómico, artista, etc. Muy interesante el enfoque y muy agradable la presentación de los diversos temas.

Si hubieran más estrellas, bien valdría la pena anotarlas todas. Lástima que solo nos permiten 5. Pero yo pongo 500, qué les parece???? Lo merecen los profesores, el staff, técnicos, la universidad. Gracias, gracias  y gracias. No hay palabra más hermosa que esa.Los espero con nuevas ediciones y con nuevos cursos. Estaré esperando. No se olviden de mi.
Aprendiendo,divirtiendome ,solo me falta interaccionar más con la gente del curso, a ver si lo consigo.
Excellent course and widely recommended
MARAVILHOSO !!!!!!!!!

Felicitaciones al los profesores y U de Barcelona por este curso que voy a denominar con respeto "simpático" por la variedad de temas y enfoques; mal que mal los seres humanos en la historia hemos realizado muchas mas actividades que comercio, guerras y contrucciones. Las presentaciones excelentes, bien acompañadas por maravillosas imágenes
